page.title: 14Transport
page.content: {Mr Jukes}father started Jukes haulage firm in 1921 and it is still going today. Mr Jukes' father's name was Richard. His first lorry was a Morris and he lugged coal. He could only carry one and a half tons. Then he bought a new Bedford for Â£102 which carried stock. This Bedford could carry 2 tons. Then Mr J Jukes took over. He bought 3 Bedford stock lorries and 3 Volvos which Richard Jukes, Les Morgan and Chris Barber drive. {Bus service.}There are two services provided by Griffiths(the local firm) and Primrose Motors of Leominster. Primrose provide a service to Leominster every Friday. Griffiths own 7 buses and 5 minibuses. They run a daily service to Ludlow, and a weekly service to Knighton and to Craven Arms.
